title: About
text:
ğŸŒŒ Welcome to the Chi-Files!
This blog is a reflection of my journey as a data enthusiast, tech explorer, and creative thinker. I embrace the philosophy that data is the new waterâ€”essential, clean, and something that everyone can consume. ğŸ’§


ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» Who Am I?
By profession, I am a Data Visualization Specialist, but my role often extends into the realms of data science, analytics, and storytelling. My passion lies in transforming raw data into meaningful insights that drive impactful decisions. I thrive at the intersection of tech and creativity, where I delight in exploring tools like R (with a particular affection for ggplot2), SQL, Databricks, and even tranformating mundane Microsoft PowerPoints into storytelling platforms.
Iâ€™m a curious explorer, balancing my technical skills with the art of data storytelling. Whether itâ€™s diving into complex datasets or creating visual art with ggplot2, I aim to turn data into a source of inspiration and knowledge.


A Few Fun Facts

ğŸ± I consider myself a non-domesticated â€œcatâ€â€”independent, curious, and constantly exploring, while embracing the thrill of discovery.
ğŸŒŠ I love the energy of waves, from the oceanâ€™s surf to the intrigue of radio waves.
ğŸ¶ Dogs hold a special place in my heart, and my furry companion is always nearby.
ğŸ’§ Iâ€™m a proud advocate for making data accessible, clean, and essentialâ€”just like water.
ğŸ›¸ The blog name, â€œChi-Files,â€ hints at my love for mystery, exploration, and a touch of the unknown.



âœï¸ Why This Blog?
I created this space to share my learnings, experiments, and discoveries in data, visualization, and technology. Youâ€™ll find a mix of professional insights, personal reflections, and creative projectsâ€”sometimes with a dash of abstract art or intriguing ggplot2 visuals. ğŸ¨ğŸ“Š
This blog is also a space to inspire others, showcasing how data can be both functional and beautiful, analytical and artistic. ğŸ’¡


ğŸŒŠ Join the Journey
Feel free to explore, share, and connect. Whether youâ€™re a fellow data enthusiast, a curious learner, or someone looking for inspiration, I hope you find value in the Chi-Files.
Letâ€™s ride the waves of data and discovery together! ğŸŒŠâœ¨

title: Hello World! The First Post!
text:
Every great journey begins with a single stepâ€”or in this case, a single post. Really Iâ€™m just trying to learn how to use Quartoâ€¦


The blog name is a nod to my love of mystery, discovery, and exploration. Data can be like an unsolved caseâ€”full of patterns, stories, and hidden gems waiting to be uncovered.



X-Files





In the Chi-Files, every dataset is a puzzle, and the chi-square statistic is our investigative tool to uncover hidden relationships.
The formula for the chi-square statistic is:
\[
\chi^2 = \sum \frac{(O_i - E_i)^2}{E_i}
\]
Where: - \(O_i\) = Observed frequency - \(E_i\) = Expected frequency - \(\sum\) = The summation symbol, meaning we sum across all categories.



Suppose weâ€™re investigating sightings of UFOs ğŸ‘½ across regions:








Region
Observed Sightings (\(O_i\))
Expected Sightings (\(E_i\))




Area 51
50
40


Roswell
70
60


Pine Gap
30
50



Using the chi-square formula, we calculate:
\[
\chi^2 = \frac{(50 - 40)^2}{40} + \frac{(70 - 60)^2}{60} + \frac{(30 - 50)^2}{50}
\]
This leads to:
\[
\chi^2 = \frac{100}{40} + \frac{100}{60} + \frac{400}{50} = 2.5 + 1.67 + 8 = 12.17
\]
If this value exceeds the critical value, we may conclude thereâ€™s something strange going on in these regionsâ€¦ but the truth is out there! ğŸ›¸















Important



The chi-square test reveals mysteries hidden in plain data. Use it wisely, and remember: the truth is out there! ğŸ›¸


Visit Quarto

title: Testing out Post with Code
text:
Welcome to my post about ggplot2! Hereâ€™s an example plot:

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) + 
  geom_point()
